headline: Fed decision, GDP & ADP, Microsoft & Meta earnings: 3 things
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman goes over the top three stories for investors to watch on Wednesday, Jul. 30. The Federal Reserve's FOMC meeting continues into its second day. At 2 p.m., Chairman Jerome Powell will announce whether interest rates will be cut or held steady. Tune in to Yahoo Finance on Wednesday at 2 p.m. for coverage of the Fed's rate decision and at 2:30 p.m. for Chair Powell's press conference. GDP data and ADP data are out this morning, both coming in better than expected. Meta (META) and Microsoft (MSFT) quarterly earnings results will be posted after the closing bell, as investors watch closely on artificial intelligence (AI) spending. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Scowtt Appoints Abhishek Priya as Head of Engineering to Advance AI Innovation in Customer Acquisition
summary: Scowtt, the AI-native customer acquisition platform, today announced the appointment of Abhishek Priya as its first Head of Engineering, solidifying the company's founding leadership team and accelerating the next phase of product innovation. headline: Palo Alto to scoop up CyberArk for $25 billion to tackle AI-era threats
summary: (Reuters) -Palo Alto Networks will buy Israeli peer CyberArk Software for about $25 billion, in its biggest deal yet, as CEO Nikesh Arora seeks to create a comprehensive cybersecurity provider to tap into rising AI-driven demand.  Wednesday's cash-and-stock deal, one of the largest tech takeovers this year, underscores a consolidation in the cybersecurity industry as customers streamline vendors after facing breaches while relying on a patchwork of firms.  It follows Alphabet's $32 billion acquisition of Israeli startup Wiz in March, and will broaden Palo Alto's cybersecurity offerings by adding identity security tools, bolstering its appeal to large enterprise customers.

raw.headline: Palo Alto to scoop up CyberArk for $25 billion to tackle AI-era threats
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Palo Alto Networks will buy Israeli peer CyberArk Software for about $25 billion, in its biggest deal yet, as CEO Nikesh Arora seeks to create a comprehensive cybersecurity provider to tap into rising AI-driven demand.  Wednesday's cash-and-stock deal, one of the largest tech takeovers this year, underscores a consolidation in the cybersecurity industry as customers streamline vendors after facing breaches while relying on a patchwork of firms.  It follows Alphabet's $32 billion acquisition of Israeli startup Wiz in March, and will broaden Palo Alto's cybersecurity offerings by adding identity security tools, bolstering its appeal to large enterprise customers.

headline: Helion Energy starts construction on nuclear fusion plant to power Microsoft data centers
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Helion Energy, a startup backed by OpenAI's Sam Altman and SoftBank's venture capital arm, has started construction on a site for a planned nuclear fusion power plant that will supply power to Microsoft data centers by 2028, the company said on Wednesday.  The site in Malaga, Washington, is in the center of the state along the Columbia River, where Helion hopes to take advantage of grid infrastructure in place for the nearby Rock Island Dam hydroelectric plant.

The site in Malaga, Washington, is in the center of the state along the Columbia River, where Helion hopes to take advantage of grid infrastructure in place for the nearby Rock Island Dam hydroelectric plant.
